text: Yunusemre (former name: Saru) is a neighbourhood of the municipality and district of Mihalıççık, Eskişehir Province, Turkey. It is named after the great Turkish poet Yunus Emre (1238–1320) whose tomb is in the town. ==Geography== Yunusemre is situated along the Porsuk River and the railroad connecting Ankara to Istanbul. It is 100 kilometres (62 mi) east of Eskişehir. ==References== Category:Neighborhoods Category:Cities in Turkey Category:Central Anatolia Region
title: Yunusemre, Mihalıçcık
